document.docAuthor: Martínez, Leonel, Brescovit, Antonio D. & Quijano, Luis G.
document.docTitle: Tenedos dankittipakuli Martínez & Brescovit & Quijano 2022, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Revealing the diversity of ant-eating spiders in Colombia I: morphology, distribution and taxonomy of the barronus group of the genus Tenedos O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1897 (Araneae: Zodariidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revealing the diversity of ant-eating spiders in Colombia I: morphology, distribution and taxonomy of the barronus group of the genus Tenedos O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1897 (Araneae: Zodariidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype : COLOMBIA . Norte de Santander : Cucutilla , Vereda Carrizal , Sector Sisavita , Quebrada Poveda , Secondary forest dominated by
Quercus humboldti , Pitfall
trap,
2040-2200m
, [ 7°28′28′′N , 72°50′11′′W ], E. González , A. Pulido & A. Santamaria leg.,
28.III.2002
, 1 ♂ (IAvH-I-585)
.
Paratypes : same data as the holotype, 1 ♀ (IAvH-I-579)
1 ♂ (IAvH-I-588)
, 1 ♂ (IAvH-I-587), 1 ♂ (IAvH-I-590), 1 ♂ (IAvH-I-581), 1 ♂ (IAvH-I-571), 1 ♂ (ICN-Ar-12917),
1 ♂ ( IBSP 276622 ), 1 ♂ ( MACN 42046 );
26-28. III .2002
,
1 ♀ ( MACN 42051 ), 1 ♀ ( IBSP 276631 ), 1 ♂ ( MACN 42052 ), 1 ♂ ( IBSP 276632 )
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 76.
Tenedos dankittipakuli
sp. n.
A–B. Male habitus (IAvH-I-585): A. Dorsal view. B. Ventral view. C–D. Female habitus (IAvH-I-579): C. Dorsal view. D. Ventral view. Scale bar: A–D: 2mm.

FIGURE 77.
Tenedos dankittipakuli
sp. n.
A–D. Male palp (IAvH-I-585): A. Prolateral view. B. Retroventral view. C. Ventral view. D. Retrolateral view. E–F. Female epigyne (IAvH-I-579): E. Ventral view. F. Dorsal view. Scale bars: A–B: 300µm; C–D: 500µm; E–F: 200µm.

FIGURE 78.
Tenedos dankittipakuli
sp. n.
A–B. Male palp (IAvH-I-585): A. Ventral view. B. Retrolateral view. C–D. Female epigyne (IAvH-I-579): C. Ventral view. D. Dorsal view. Scale bars: A–B: 200µm; C–D: 500µm. Abbreviations: aMA, anterior branch of the median apophysis; aRTA, anterior branch of the retrolateral tibial apophysis; bRTA, basal retrolateral tibial apophysis; C, conductor; E, embolus; FD, fertilization ducts; LB, lateral borders; MFP, median field plate; pMA, posterior branch of the median apophysis; pRTA, posterior branch of the retrolateral tibial apophysis; S, spermathecae; SD, spermatic ducts; SR, seminal receptacles; VTA, ventral tibial apophysis.

FIGURE 79.
Tenedos dankittipakuli
sp. n.
A–B. Male habitus (IAvH-I-578): A. Dorsal view. B. Ventral view. C–D. Female habitus (IAvH-I-578): C. Dorsal view. D. Ventral view. Scale bar: A–D: 2mm.

FIGURE 80.
Tenedos dankittipakuli
sp. n.
A–D. Male palp (IAvH-I-578): A. Prolateral view. B. Retroventral view. C. Ventral view. D. Retrolateral view. E–F. Female epigyne (IAvH-I-578): E. Ventral view. F. Dorsal view. Scale bars: A–B: 300µm; C–D: 500µm; E–F: 200µm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Non-type material.
COLOMBIA . Norte de Santander : Cucutilla , Vereda Carrizal , Sector Sisavita , Quebrada Poveda , Secondary forest Secondary forest dominated by
Quercus humboldti , Pitfall
trap,
2040-2200m
, [ 7°28′28′′N , 72°50′11′′W ], E. González , A. Pulido & A. Santamaria leg.,
26-28.III.2002
, 1 ♀ , 1 ♂ (IAvH-I-578)
.
Etymology. The specific epithet is a patronymic in honor of the arachnologist Pakawin Dankittipakul by his contributions to the taxonomy and systematic of the ant-eating spiders.

Variation . Males (n=8): total length: 5.26–6.02; carapace length: 2.90–3.02; femur I length: 1.93–2.01. Some specimens of
Tenedos dankittipakuli
sp. n.
exhibit morphological variation such as spots number on abdomen, the size and shape of the median apophysis and retrolateral tibial apophysis ( Fig. 80A–D ).
Distribution. Known from Norte de Santander department ( Fig. 106 ).
